results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/21]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. What is at stake in the French elections - The events leading up the dissolution of the French National Assembly and making ready for the new legislative elections. 2. Techniques - 765,000 volt circuit-breakers for the US. Near Paris, finishing touches on a revolutionary combustion-cell. 3. School for aces - Test Pilots’ School: routine coasting-tests for transport with feathered engines. The arts - Pierre-Yves Tremois, one of the best French engravers of the modern school.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/06]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Le rallye de Monte Carlo - brief description and footage of the 37th Monte Carlo rally. Brief glimpse of Princess Grace Kelly and family. 2. Paul Claudel - brief biographical details of career diplomat Paul Claudel who combined his job as Ambassador to US and Vatican City with his work as playwright, poet, philosopher. 3. La danse - footage of Grand Classical Ballet of France returning to Paris from tour. 4. La mode - footage and description of spring/summer 1968 collection from fashion designer, Ted Lapidus. 5. Des skieurs belle epoque - traces the history of skiing through to its accept in 1936 as a winter olympics sport.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/04]
results.brief_description: French cineagazine items including: 1. Grenoble, Olympic capital - On the eve of the Winter Olympics, Grenoble has had its face lifted. She is ready for this major sports competition. 2. Sports - Rugby: a good start for the French team in the 5 nations tournament. 3. Metal woman - Is metallurgy going into women’s fashions? Coats of mail and helmets have become the newest “material”. 4. Canada and modern art - A new exhibition in Paris, launched by the words of Andre Malraux “An absolutely specific palette has arisen - that of Canada”. 5. Master copyists - Purposeful or accidental? A Parisian art-collector has asembled an impressive collection of masterpieces with strange analogies. Says Salvador Dali: “Perrugino painted immortal canvases; Raphael copied them, and suddenly the miracle of Raphael’s originality came to the fore”.
